docs.text:
Visualizations for Advent of Code puzzles.

Find my solutions for Advent of Code here and my visualization code here.

docs.title: Day 4: Printing Department
docs.text: The heat of each roll represents how long it has been since it was removed by the forklifts.

docs.title: Day 7: Laboratories
docs.text: The heat of each tachyon beam represents how many timelines go through that specific point.

docs.title: Day 8: Playground
docs.text: The heat of each junction box represents how many junction boxes are in its circuit.

docs.title: Day 9: Movie Theater
docs.text: First we compress the grid, then we draw the polygon, then flood fill the outside. Next we can try every possible rectangle (in order of how large their areas are) until we find one that doesn't have any cells in the outside portion of the grid. This visualization only shows a few of the possible rectangles (including the largest valid one at the end).
